settingsPane.description: Here you can choose whether to apply STweaks settings on BOOT or not.
settingsPane.name: Global BOOT Settings

spinner.description: Master Switch - load ALL settings from ALL tabs on BOOT or not! Default is LOAD.
spinner.name: Enable On Boot

spinnerItem.name: Don't load all Settings on boot

button.description: Push this in order to load all tuned settings IF the master switch is (or was already) OFF. If the master switch was ON when phone booted, then you don't need to touch this, wait until STweaks will close then start STweaks again if you wish.
button.name: LOAD ALL
button.label: LOAD ALL

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune the CPU Active Governor per core
settingsPane.name: CPU Active Governor

spinner.description: This will set the CPU0 governor.
spinner.name: Default CPU0 Governor

spinner.description: This will set the CPU1 governor.
spinner.name: Default CPU1 Governor

spinner.description: This will set the CPU2 governor.
spinner.name: Default CPU2 Governor

spinner.description: This will set the CPU3 governor.
spinner.name: Default CPU3 Governor

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune the CPU Power and Boost Controls
settingsPane.name: CPU Power and Boost Controls

spinner.description: Touch boost control - when you touch the screen or scroll, the CPU's frequency will be boosted to maximum frequency set in order to help reducing LAG and allow fast and smooth operations. Too high frequencies will use more power. Default is 1.19 GHz.
spinner.name: Touch Boost Frequency

seekBar.description: Here you can set Touch Boost duration in micro seconds! 10ms is equal 0.01sec and boost is set every 0.15sec interval when screen is touched for this set duration, it's ultra fast!
seekBar.name: CPU Touch Boost duration

seekBar.description: Here you can set how many cores affected by Touch Boost Frequency
seekBar.name: Affected Cores On Touch Boost

spinner.description: Here you can enable or disable touch boost frequency set on activated core from sleep for one round. core wakeup, first frequency it's get is the boost frequency, then do his work with cpu governor decided frequency, it's not depend on user touch screen or not, but its depend on how many cores boosted above.
spinner.name: Touch Boost HotPlug CPU

seekBar.description: Here you can select CPU governor sample rate when using Power Save mode below, lower the value faster responce you get, but more power drained. default rate is 50000
seekBar.name: CPU Governor Sample Rate

spinner.description: Here you can select 2 modes! one for power save! and one for performance!, On power save responce will be normal! when performance mode selected, high presure responce allowed with max power CPU governor will be tuned with 10000 sample rate and above tuning is ignored!.
spinner.name: Power Save Switch

checkbox.description: Enable or disable Power-efficient Workqueues will help to reduce power consumption at the cost of slight performance overhead. By enabling this, PE workqueues are used for unbound scheduled work to save load on sibling CPU cores and queuing work on CPU 0.
checkbox.name: Power-efficient Workqueues
checkbox.label: Power-efficient Workqueues

checkbox.description: Enable or disable CPU-Tweaks below! If ON, then kernel will obey only STweaks and set the frequencies selected below, on screen OFF and ON
checkbox.name: CPU-Tweaks
checkbox.label: CPU-Tweaks

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune the Maximum CPU Frequency per core, when set here no other APP or Service can set higher!!!
settingsPane.name: Maximum CPU Frequency

spinner.description: Maximum CPU0 Speed. Here, you can change the maximum CPU0 frequency allowed. This depends on CPU-Tweaks (has to be enabled above)! (Default is 2 265 600 Khz)
spinner.name: Max CPU0 Frequency

spinner.description: Maximum CPU1 Speed. Here, you can change the maximum CPU1 frequency allowed. This depends on CPU-Tweaks (has to be enabled above)! (Default is 2 265 600 Khz)
spinner.name: Max CPU1 Frequency

spinner.description: Maximum CPU2 Speed. Here, you can change the maximum CPU2 frequency allowed. This depends on CPU-Tweaks (has to be enabled above)! (Default is 2 265 600 Khz)
spinner.name: Max CPU2 Frequency

spinner.description: Maximum CPU3 Speed. Here, you can change the maximum CPU3 frequency allowed. This depends on CPU-Tweaks (has to be enabled above)! (Default is 2 265 600 Khz)
spinner.name: Max CPU3 Frequency

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune the Minimum CPU Frequency per core
settingsPane.name: Minimum CPU Frequency

spinner.description: Minimum CPU0 Speed. Here, you can change the minimum CPU0 frequency allowed (it can't be higher than Maximum CPU0 Speed). This depends on CPU-Tweaks (has to be enabled above)! (Default is 300 000 Khz)
spinner.name: Min CPU0 Frequency

spinner.description: Minimum CPU1 Speed. Here, you can change the minimum CPU1 frequency allowed (it can't be higher than Maximum CPU1 Speed). This depends on CPU-Tweaks (has to be enabled above)! (Default is 300 000 Khz)
spinner.name: Min CPU1 Frequency

spinner.description: Minimum CPU2 Speed. Here, you can change the minimum CPU2 frequency allowed (it can't be higher than Maximum CPU2 Speed). This depends on CPU-Tweaks (has to be enabled above)! (Default is 300 000 Khz)
spinner.name: Min CPU2 Frequency

spinner.description: Minimum CPU3 Speed. Here, you can change the minimum CPU3 frequency allowed (it can't be higher than Maximum CPU3 Speed). This depends on CPU-Tweaks (has to be enabled above)! (Default is 300 000 Khz)
spinner.name: Min CPU3 Frequency

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune the Maximum Suspend Frequency on core0 it's only one that work.
settingsPane.name: Max Suspend Frequency

spinner.description: Maximum allowed CPU frequency when screen is OFF and phone is awake (by any app that holds wakelocks, such as music apps etc). This is ONLY for screen OFF. When screen is ON, normal maximum allowed frequency will be set.
spinner.name: MAX Screen OFF CPU Frequency

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune CPU Thermal Controls, with this kernel ROM thermal service and Intelligent Thermal Kernel driver can be enabled together! To protect your device from overheating and melting the chipset, screen and your fingers! Controls below are active for Dual Intelligent Temp Control. In case the ROM service dies, kernel will protect your chipset, LCD and other components from damage! only if Dual Intelligent Temp Control is used
settingsPane.name: CPU Thermal Protection

spinner.description: CPU Thermal control, Can be Default driver without controls, or Dual Intelligent Thermal driver with controls below and ROM thermal control, it will limit CPU frequency when CPU reach the max limit heat, till cooled and restore full power, by using Default Temp Control you have one temp protection by ROM, and if ROM stuck and hotboot there is no one to protect your CPU from heatup the LCD and burn it. BUT you get better game performance by using ONE protection. when Dual Intelligent Temp Control enabled, kernel protects your hardware in any condition! reboot or hotboot! or any other problem. also it's possible to use only Intelligent Temp Control, then ROM service is turned OFF. only kernel control the CPU temp.
spinner.name: CPU Temp Control

button.description: To access CPU Thermal Controls and LIVE stats from my kernel PUSH the BUTTON!
button.name: Thermal Controls Access
button.label: Switch to Synapse Controls

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune CPU HotPlug and CPU Governors
settingsPane.name: Global HOTPLUG

spinner.description: CPU HotPlug Control - you can switch from OLD LG Default Hot Plug driver to MSM Hot Plug, Intelligent Hot Plug or Alucard driver. Note that using Intelligent CPU Thermal Control with Default LG HotPlug is NOT recommended (low performance)!
spinner.name: Hot Plug Driver

spinner.description: CPU HotPlug Suspend Control - you can allow hotplug to be suspended when screen is OFF to save little more power on deepsleep, then resume when screen is ON, BUT it's will DELAY In Call screen wakeup! for 3sec as when screen is OFF, you have only ONE core active with suspend mode. also using suspend mode can prevent wake up for some devices for unknown reason!!!. so if you wish to test suspend mode go ahead, if you get SOD switch to Always Active mode and stay there (default mode). for many it's working fine. this is for all kernel hotplugs, default hotplug is not supported.
spinner.name: Hot Plug Suspend Mode

spinner.description: Additional CPU HotPlug control - here you can tune how many cores will be active on a high load spikes for a short time (default is 2 cores for 4 sec). If you wish to save more power when using MSM or Intelligent HotPlug, then it is best to use 1 core boost. If performance is what you prefer, then use DUAL or more cores boost. Depend on MSM or Intelligent Hot Plug selected!
spinner.name: Hot Plug CPU Booster

seekBar.description: Here you can adjust the CPU BOOST time duration, when hotplug turn the amount of boosted cpus on spike load. it's for MSM and INTELLIGENT Hotplugs only! 1000msec equal 1sec (default is 750msec)
seekBar.name: CPU Booster Duration

spinner.description: Maximum allowed CPU Cores online - you can have QUAD CORE, or select CPU CORE type that you want, This mod will work with all custom hotplugs! Default LG hotplug is not supported. This set is stronger than MIN cores online below!
spinner.name: Max Cores online

spinner.description: Minimum allowed CPU Cores online - here you can set the minimum number of CPU cores to be online nonstop when screen is ON. By default, we have only one core online when device is idle. You can set 2, 3 or all 4 if you wish - this will give your device much more power, but will drain the battery faster and warm up the device faster. Default is NORMAL (one core online + other cores offline until needed). This setting is weaker than MAX cores online above! If you set 2 max cores online and 4 min cores online, you get 2 cores max.
spinner.name: Min CPU Online

settingsPane.description: Here you can select the GPU Governor, set Min and Max GPU frequency and update tuning.
settingsPane.name: GPU Governors and settings

spinner.description: Select GPU Governor that will control GPU frequency according to GPU load and system needs - if you select Performance Governor, then the GPU will be at MAX frequency nonstop!
spinner.name: GPU Active Governor

button.description: To update GPU Governor tuning after selection, Push This
button.name: Update GPU Governor Tuning
button.label: Update GPU Governor

spinner.description: Select GPU Max frequency when needed! GPU will stay at MIN freq on IDLE.
spinner.name: GPU Max Speed

spinner.description: Select GPU Min frequency when going to IDLE - if you set higher than 200 MHz, then the GPU will hold selected frequency on IDLE.
spinner.name: GPU Min Speed

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune Msm-Adreno-Tz Governor! Use the controls ONLY if Msm-Adreno-Tz is selected (otherwise nothing will happen).
settingsPane.name: Msm-Adreno-Tz Controls

seekBar.description: Msm-Adreno-Tz CAP, more info will be added later, must NOT be HIGHER than TARGET value! (Default: 75)
seekBar.name: CAP Value

seekBar.description: Msm-Adreno-tz TARGET, more info will be added later, must NOT be LOWER than TARGET value! (Default: 80)
seekBar.name: TARGET Value

spinner.description: Here you can manually control Simple_ramp_threshold and Simple_laziness value, or let the Governor decide automatically. If set to AUTO, then controls below have no effect.
spinner.name: Msm-Adreno-Tz Extra Controls

seekBar.description: Msm-Adreno-Tz Simple_Laziness control, more info will be added later (Default: 4)
seekBar.name: Simple_Laziness Value

seekBar.description: Msm-Adreno-Tz Simple_ramp_threshold control, more info will be added later (Default: 5000)
seekBar.name: Simple_Laziness Value

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune Simple_Ondemand Governor! Use the controls ONLY if Simple_Ondemand is selected (otherwise nothing will happen).
settingsPane.name: Simple_Ondemand Controls

seekBar.description: Simple_Ondemand Downdifferential - when GPU load drops below Downdifferential, GPU frequency is reduced to MIN (must NOT be HIGHER than Upthreshold value)! (Default equal 20)
seekBar.name: Downdifferential Value

seekBar.description: Simple_Ondemand Upthreshold - when GPU load raises above Upthreshold, GPU frequency is raised to next frequency step until it reaches MAX (must NOT be LOWER than Downdifferential)! (Default equal 60)
seekBar.name: Upthreshold Value

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune Conservative Governor! Use the controls ONLY if Conservative is selected (otherwise nothing will happen).
settingsPane.name: Conservative Controls

seekBar.description: Conservative Downthreshold - hen GPU load drops below Downdifferential, GPU frequency is reduced to MIN (must NOT be HIGHER than Upthreshold value)! (Default equal 20)
seekBar.name: Downthreshold Value

seekBar.description: Conservative Upthreshold - when GPU load raises above Upthreshold, GPU frequency is raised to next frequency step until it reaches MAX (must NOT be LOWER than Downthreshold)! (Default equal 50)
seekBar.name: Upthreshold Value

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune MIC and SPEAKER volume gain
settingsPane.name: Sound Controls

seekBar.description: Control for Camera recording MIC gain volume!
seekBar.name: Camera MIC gain

seekBar.description: Control for Handset MIC gain volume on call!
seekBar.name: Handset MIC gain on call

seekBar.description: Control for Speaker gain volume! When you set higher, better listen to music so you will know when it is more than what the hardware can handle. If you already have sound control mods, USE THEM, as mods override STweaks control! This is not a bug - your sound mod is bugged instead!
seekBar.name: Speaker Gain

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune I/O settings managed by Kernel
settingsPane.name: I/O Tuning

spinner.description: Maximum number of kilobytes to read-ahead for SDCARD! It's best to leave it at 1024 KB. (Default equal 1024 KB)
spinner.name: kilobytes to read-ahead

button.description: Use this button to Trim System and Data Nand partitions to speed up Read and Write Access, good to use once in a day or two.
button.name: Trim System and Data
button.label: Trim NOW

spinner.description: This will set the default AWAKE I/O scheduler for internal storage. (Default equal ROW)
spinner.name: Default Awake I/O Scheduler

spinner.description: This will set the DEEPSLEEP I/O scheduler for internal storage. Depends on CortexBrain-Background-Process! (Default equal ROW)
spinner.name: DEEPSLEEP I/O Scheduler

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune memory and OOM (low memory management) settings managed by the kernel.
settingsPane.name: Memory Tuning

checkbox.description: Enable AUTO OOM control using the profiles below; disable if you want to set your own OOM tuning via another app or script.
checkbox.name: Auto OOM
checkbox.label: Auto OOM Control

spinner.description: Here you can set the level of low memory management by kernel lowmemkiller function. More aggressive equals more free RAM but more killed apps.
spinner.name: OOM Level Screen ON

spinner.description: Here you can set the level of low memory management by kernel lowmemkiller function. More aggressive equals more free RAM but more killed apps.
spinner.name: OOM Level Screen OFF

seekBar.description: Dirty background memory buffer. The more you set, the more memory will be used for write buffer for background operations. Buffer is released when it is needed to free RAM
seekBar.name: Dirty Background ratio

seekBar.description: Dirty real time memory buffer. The more you set, the more memory will be used for write buffer for real time operations. Buffer is released when it is needed to free RAM
seekBar.name: Dirty ratio

button.description: Clean RAM Cache - this will release all cached and buffered RAM. WAIT 3 sec to get cleanup report!
button.name: CLEAN RAM CACHE
button.label: CLEAN RAM CACHE NOW

settingsPane.description: Here you can activate some scripts which will automatically run in the background at a specified time.
settingsPane.name: cron

spinner.description: Main switch for Cron Tasker. If you set this to OFF, then all tasks below have no effect!
spinner.name: CRON TASK MAIN SWITCH

button.description: Use this button to test if this Cron Task service is ONLINE and supported! If main switch is ON and service is OFFLINE, then ROM Busybox is not supporting Cron. Update Busybox or ROM for this to work.
button.name: Test Cron Task Service
button.label: Test Cron Task Service

button.description: Use this button to RESET the scripts and jobs from kernel, to refresh the configuration. This will clear all your custom changes!
button.name: CRON RESET
button.label: RESET CRON

checkbox.description: Cron to clear file-cache every hour, but only if CPU is resting (IDLE) and more than 50% of your memory is used! This will free RAM from unused buffers and cache.
checkbox.name: Clean file-cache
checkbox.label: RAM cache clean every hour

checkbox.description: Enable Trim of System, Data and Cache partitions every day at 6:00AM to speed up NAND Read and Write Access
checkbox.name: Trim every day 6:00AM
checkbox.label: Trim every day

checkbox.description: Cron to update AD-BLOCKER every week at SAT 6:00AM UTC time, from official site. The script will check, if you are connected with the internet, otherwise it will try to use WIFI! Script will turn wifi, wait for connection and update, then when it is finished it will turn WIFI off. If there is no connection, an error will be written in the log.
checkbox.name: Update AD-Block
checkbox.label: Update AD-BLOCKER every week

checkbox.description: Cron to DB Optimize every day at 3:00 AM, only if CPU is resting (IDLE)!
checkbox.name: DB Optimization
checkbox.label: DB Optimization task every day at 3:00 AM

checkbox.description: Cron to clear app-cache every day at 4:00 AM, only if CPU is resting (IDLE)!
checkbox.name: Clean app-cache
checkbox.label: Disk Clean task every day at 4:00 AM

checkbox.description: Cron to zipalign app every day at 4:50 AM, only if CPU is resting (IDLE)! This can help to reduce errors, bugs, applications FC, and improve applications load speed. WARNING! Backup all apps before use, as this process will remove apps that are BROKEN and not compressed or compiled correctly, so you may find some apps missing! Use it AT YOUR OWN RISK and update the broken applications!
checkbox.name: Zipalign Task
checkbox.label: Zipalign Task Every day at 4:50 AM

button.description: Use this button to check if Cron Task Jobs are done as requested. This will show the log for all finished jobs.
button.name: Test Cron Task jobs
button.label: Test Cron Task Jobs

settingsPane.description: Here you can find some settings and options for your apps.
settingsPane.name: Apps

button.description: Click here to start Zipaligning ONLY user apps. System may be unresponsive - it is OK, do not use phone for 2 minutes. WARNING! Backup all apps before use, as this process will remove apps that are BROKEN and not compressed or compiled correctly, so you may find some apps missing! Use it AT YOUR OWN RISK and update the broken applications!
button.name: ZIPALIGN
button.label: ZIPALIGN ALL APPS

button.description: Click here to start applications Database Optimization. Compacting, cleaning and indexing will take max 2 mins.
button.name: DB OPTIMIZATION
button.label: DATABASE OPTIMIZATON

spinner.description: Allows you to change your SELinux (Security-Enhanced Linux) Status from Enforcing (policy is enforced) to Permissive (prints warnings instead of enforcing).
spinner.name: SeLinux Control

settingsPane.description: Camera ROM Driver Reset
settingsPane.name: Camera Reset

button.description: Click here to RESET camera driver if you see BLACK screen when you open camera! That is a KK ROM BUG of unknown origin for now. So, you can REBOOT or just push Reset Camera Now, then reopen camera.
button.name: Reset Camera Driver
button.label: RESET CAMERA NOW

settingsPane.description: Screen Backlight Control, here you can set custom values for Auto backlight driver.
settingsPane.name: Min BackLight Control

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable custom backlight override set below, this will allow user to set MIN backlight in full darkness.
checkbox.name: Min Backlight Override Switch
checkbox.label: Min Backlight Override Switch

seekBar.description: If custom backlight switch is ON above!, you can set the MIN backlight in dark place when ROM auto backlight is used, and you feel that screen is too bright! in order for change to take effect you need to make the screen brighter then set auto, and see that it's will be darker than was on default. you can see live change only if current LUX is under 100! (Default ROM value equal 80Lux, and when screen is dimmed before turn off it's 50Lux)
seekBar.name: Min Backlight Lux

settingsPane.description: Congestion control concerns controlling traffic entry into a telecommunications network, so as to avoid congestive collapse by attempting to avoid oversubscription of any of the processing or link capabilities of the intermediate nodes and networks and taking resource reducing steps.
settingsPane.name: Net Congestion Control

spinner.description: Allow USER to READ GOOGLE! Then come here and select what he thinks is BEST for him for NET Congestion Control. If the USER is lazy to read Google, then leave it default (CUBIC) and don't ask what is the difference!
spinner.name: Net Congestion Control

settingsPane.description: WIFI Settings
settingsPane.name: WIFI

button.description: Clean WIFI DHCP IP Lease. Push the button to activate!
button.name: Clean WIFI Lease
button.label: Clean WIFI Lease

settingsPane.description: Here you can change GPS and NTP settings.
settingsPane.name: GPS - NTP

spinner.description: GPS Time Zone for faster GPS lock! Use your region!
spinner.name: GPS Region

button.description: Click to see your current GPS ZONE
button.name: GPS ZONE
button.label: GPS ZONE CHECK

settingsPane.description: Here you can Add, Update or Remove AD Blocker! You need ROOT to do the tweak! If you want to update the blocker, you can push the UPDATE AD NOW button, to get the new one installed! If you install a new ROM, and you want to use AD BLOCKER, then push UPDATE AD NOW and REBOOT. If you need to REMOVE AD-BLOCKER use the REMOVE button and REBOOT
settingsPane.name: AD Blocker

button.description: ADD or UPDATE AD BLOCKER
button.name: AD-B UPDATE or ADD
button.label: UPDATE AD-B NOW

button.description: REMOVE AD Blocker
button.name: AD-B REMOVE
button.label: REMOVE AD-B NOW

checkbox.description: Enable or disable INIT.D scripts to RUN on boot. If you put scripts in INIT.D, then enable the switch. Default SuperSu script will run on boot by kernel from init.d.
checkbox.name: INIT.D Scripts RUN control
checkbox.label: Enable INIT.D scripts RUN-control

settingsPane.description: Android Additional Logs and logcat.
settingsPane.name: Logcat Logger

spinner.description: Enable or disable Android Additional Logs and logcat. You can choose Always Disabled to save power, or leave default (ON when screen ON and OFF when screen is OFF).
spinner.name: Android Logcat Logger

spinnerItem.name: Enabled only when screen is ON

settingsPane.description: Fast Charge control menu - here you can set the force Fast Charge option when MTP is used as USB connection!
settingsPane.name: Fast Charge Control

spinner.description: Fast Charge ON or OFF. Also, you can force charge mA limit! For this, select manual and set below the requested limit. If it is set to ON, then default limit is 1200mA. If your charger can't give you 1.2A, don't expect to see 1200mA charge! HOW TO, disconnect Power before any change in this control. change and connect power.
spinner.name: Force Fast Charge Switch

spinner.description: Fast Charge Manual mA limit! Here, you can set the max allowed mA limit when using wall charger. This will take effect ONLY if Fast Charge Manual is set above!
spinner.name: Fast Charge mA Limits

button.description: Here you can RESET battery fuel counter, if you see that battery present counter is not showing correct state, you can ask kernel to recalibrate battery state.
button.name: Reset Battery Counter
button.label: Reset Battery Counter

checkbox.description: Enable one more Force Fast Charge hack to mask any charger (including USB) as AC power. That way, we always get fast charging mode! No more SLOW CHARGE Icon! The side effect is that you get 2 connection sound and vibrations - one for USB connected and second for AC connected.
checkbox.name: Fake AC Charger
checkbox.label: Fake AC Charger Hack

checkbox.description: Enable support for iPhone or iPad chargers and treat them as AC power source - this can break support for other not original charger, so enable only if you are using iPhone or iPad chargers.
checkbox.name: Support Apple Chargers
checkbox.label: Support Apple Chargers

settingsPane.description: Enable using Android phone as USB keyboard for your PC! Let's say you don't have a keyboard and you really need one! Connect your phone via USB, get the app named USB KEYBOARD, enable this tweak here and have fun!
settingsPane.name: Android USB HID Device

spinner.description: Enable or disable USB HID Device driver to control PC keyboard and mouse from phone!
spinner.name: USB HID Device

settingsPane.description: Sweep2Sleep function control.
settingsPane.name: Sweep2Sleep

checkbox.description: Enable Sweep2Sleep function that allows to turn screen off by sweeping from right to left or backwards on the bottom of the screen (navigation bar)! If you have removed the soft buttons bar, then you have to turn this function OFF!
checkbox.name: Sweep2Sleep Control
checkbox.label: Sweep2Sleep

settingsPane.description: This script will manipulate many kernel settings, based on chosen STweaks profile + settings and screen state (ON or OFF) - we call it CortexBrain. To reset the kernel-settings after you disable a tweak, you must reboot!
settingsPane.name: CortexBrain Tweaks

spinner.description: Enable or disable the background-process from CortexBrain. If you disable it, you will lose the function that sets different settings for screen state (ON or OFF).
spinner.name: Cortexbrain-Background-Process

button.description: Click to see if the CortexBrain-Background-Process is running or not.
button.name: Check Background-Process
button.label: CHECK SERVICE

settingsPane.description: You can check what profile is in use right now.
settingsPane.name: Online Profile

button.description: This displays your currently used profile.
button.name: Profile Check
button.label: Profile Check

settingsPane.description: Here you can choose kernel profiles.
settingsPane.name: STweaks Profiles

settingsPane.description: Here you can backup or restore your profile after installing new kernel. Some settings will work only after reboot! Restore will take up to 30 sec, just wait!
settingsPane.name: STweaks Settings Backup or Restore

button.description: Backup STweaks User Settings!
button.name: Settings Backup
button.label: BACKUP NOW

button.description: Restore STweaks User Settings!
button.name: Settings Restore
button.label: RESTORE NOW

settingsPane.description: Debug to SD-Card
settingsPane.name: Bug-Report

button.description: Bug-Report for Kernel
button.name: Kernel-Bug
button.label: KERNEL-BUG

button.description: Bug-Report for Apps
button.name: App-Bug
button.label: APP-BUG

settingsPane.description: Check if there is a new kernel-update available.
settingsPane.name: Kernel-Update

button.description: Check for Update
button.name: Kernel-Update
button.label: KERNEL-CHECK

settingsPane.description: Here you can load (on boot) some kernel modules that will allow some extra functions.
settingsPane.name: Kernel Modules

checkbox.description: Enable or disable CIFS Module. This will allow you to use apps that can mount internal storage and publish over network. User can access data and system over network. No support! Takes effect only after reboot!
checkbox.name: CIFS Module
checkbox.label: CIFS Module
